content: pprrooppeerr ttrraappppiinnggss original designs delicate arch crochet scarf the real delicate arch is a natural rock formation in utah this scarf is a lot softer and easier to crochet made in a fine or sport weight yarn it will be an indoor scarf that you can wear all day after you take off your coat in a worsted weight yarn it can be made big enough to wear with a jacket the main part of the scarf is in filet mesh and once you have finished that part it goes very fast you add an arch to each end and a pretty picot border all the way around all you need to know is single and double_crochet plus of course chaining and the slipstitch full written instructions are provided but it is also a good introduction to following symbol crochet which you may find easier for the arches and edging materials yarn choose any yarn that you like i have made it in fingering sport and worsted weight yarns a bulky yarn might be interesting but i have not tried it this is a great project for an expensive yarn since it is small quantity the exact quantity of yarn will depend the weight of the yarn and the length of your scarf for most scarves you will need approximately 200 yards hook this will depend on your choice of yarn you will probably use a d 3 25 mm hook for fingering weight an e 3 5 mm hook for sport weight and an f 3 75 mm hook for worsted weight gauge this will depend on your choice of yarn you do not need to worry about it too much for this scarf just make sure that your chain stitches are not so tight that they are hard to work into in which case go up a hook size or so loose that you have lots of holes in which case choose a smaller hook in a worsted weight yarn using an f 3 75 mm hook a 4×4 inch 10×10 cm square should have approximately 10 mesh squares across and 8 mesh squares down corresponding to 31 stitches and 8 row stitches and abbreviations basic stitches and abbreviations used chain chain slipstitch single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet patterns that repeat are indicated by brackets pattern stitch filet mesh based on a multiple of 3 stitches plus 1 − begin a row with ch5 counts as double_crochet ch2 skip 1st 3 stitches the 1st double_crochet and 2 chains double_crochet into next double_crochet − continue with ch2 skip 2 chains double_crochet into next double_crochet across the row until one mesh square remains − end with ch2 and double_crochet into 3rd chain into the chain not the chain space of the ch5 of the previous row main body of scarf begin with ch25 the first row is just single_crochet ch1 as a turning chain single_crochet in 2nd chain from the hook single_crochet in next chain to end 25 stitches turn now
